meanings.sent1: The weather in spring is mutable, often changing from sunny to rainy in a short time.
meanings.sent2: Her mood was mutable, shifting from happiness to sadness throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon's mutable colors made it look like a walking rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The mutable nature of the stock market can be both exciting and nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent5: The mutable landscape of the desert seemed to transform with each passing hour.

meanings.definition: Capable of being changed or altered
meanings.sent1: The document was stored in a mutable file format, allowing easy edits.
meanings.sent2: The mutable fabric of the dress could be adjusted to fit different body shapes.
meanings.sent3: The mutable recipe allowed for endless variations depending on personal taste.
meanings.sent4: Her mutable hairstyle reflected her ever-changing personality.
meanings.sent5: The mutable clay could be molded into any shape the artist desired.
